diagnosis.priorHistory: History of Stage IIB Breast Cancer, diagnosed 08/15/2018. Treated with Chemo, RT, and ongoing Endocrine Therapy.
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Worsening right hip/thigh pain (7/10), difficulty bearing weight.

treatmentPlan.intent: Palliative (Pain control, prevention/stabilization of impending fracture)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing the lytic lesion in the R proximal femur with margin (PTV_FemurMet).
medications: Bisphosphonate or Denosumab (for bone health) - Managed by Med Onc

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine with legs in Vac-Lok bag and ankle/foot immobilization for rotational stability. SSD setup.
ctSimulation.immobilization: Vac-Lok bag, alpha cradle, or other leg immobilization device.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT of right femur acquired for 3D-CRT planning.

dosimetry.planNotes: Palliative extremity RT for impending fracture.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily kV imaging for setup verification. Matched to bone.
fractions.sideEffects: Minimal skin pinkness. Pain starting to improve (5/10).
fractions.notes: Completed 5/5 fx palliative RT. Tolerated well. Reinforced protected weight bearing instructions.

imagingAndReports.summary: New hypermetabolic lytic lesion R proximal femur (SUV 9.0). Stable small lung nodules.
Large lytic lesion involving >50% diameter of proximal femoral shaft/neck. Cortical thinning noted. High risk for pathologic fracture.
Non-contrast CT acquired supine with leg immobilization for 3D-CRT planning.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Karen Wells (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt with metastatic breast cancer on Letrozole presents with new R hip/thigh pain. Recent PET showed new femoral met. Order X-ray femur to assess fx risk. Refer to Rad Onc. Consult Ortho Onc if high risk on Xray. Continue Letrozole, increase pain meds.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Peterson (Ortho Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Reviewed case/X-rays. Lytic R prox femur met, Mirels 9. High risk pathologic fx. Recommend palliative RT for pain/stabilization. Prophylactic fixation not recommended at this time unless pain persists/lesion progresses after RT. Advised protected weight bearing.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Michael Evans (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ painful R femoral metastasis, high fx risk. Reviewed imaging, Ortho consult note. Discussed palliative RT options. Plan for 20Gy/5fx via 3D-CRT AP/PA fields. Explained goals (pain relief, prevent fx), procedure, low risk SEs (skin rxn, fatigue). Emphasized protected weight bearing. Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled urgently.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Michael Evans (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 5/5 fx palliative RT to R femur. Tolerated well. Minimal skin pinkness. Pain starting to improve (5/10). Continue protected weight bearing. Follow up with Med Onc / Ortho Onc.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Palliative treatment to relieve pain in the right thigh/hip and strengthen the bone to prevent it from breaking.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Low risk of side effects. Most common are mild fatigue and a mild skin reaction (like a sunburn) in the treated area. A temporary 'pain flare' is possible.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Crucial importance of 'protected weight bearing' as instructed by the orthopedic doctor to prevent a fracture. This may mean using crutches or a walker.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT for one week. Report any sudden increase in pain or new symptoms. Strictly adhere to weight-bearing restrictions.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Continue pain medication as needed and discuss tapering with primary oncology team as pain improves.
